result.execSummary:
The defendant Cristian Jahir Hernandez-Becerra was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting/Failing to Stop, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
- with credit for 4 days time served.  
- Court grants Huber privileges for work and school.

miscConds.notes:
- Court ordered the defendant to pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.
- Provide DNA sample.

- Court permanently stays condition time if the defendant has completed 8 hours of in person driver's education and 40 hours of community service by 12-07-2022.
* Court allows for expungement upon successful completion of probation if the defendant also has a valid drivers license and a high school diploma
* Court allows early termination of probation if the defendant completes all conditions of probation.

timeConds.notes: - 30 DAYS condition time at the House of Correction with Huber release for work and school, STAYED until 12-07-2022.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cristian Jahir Hernandez-Becerra

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Cristian Jahir Hernandez-Becerra in court with Attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.  Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Plea hearing proceeded.  

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.   Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 4 days time served.  Court grants Huber privileges for work and school.  The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 1 YEAR. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
- 30 DAYS condition time at the House of Correction with Huber release for work and school, STAYED until 12-07-2022.  Court permanently stays condition time if the defendant has completed 8 hours of in person driver's education and 40 hours of community service by 12-07-2022.
- Complete 40 hours of community service. 
- Complete 8 hours of driver's education.
- Provide DNA sample.

*Court allows for expungement upon successful completion of probation if the defendant also has a valid driver's license and a high school diploma. 
*Court allows early termination of probation if the defendant completes all conditions of probation.

Court ordered the defendant to pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment. 

20 day appeal rights given.
Received and Filed: Guilty Plea Questionnaire and Addendum
Received and Filed: Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Attorney Amanda Poznanski in court.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference. Branch 40 is down.  Court scheduled a plea/sentencing date upon request from the defense.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Attorney Colleen Cullen
Received and Filed:  Attorney Amanda Poznanski

Defendant Cristian Jahir Hernandez-Becerra in court with Attorney Connor Romenesko on behalf of Attorney Colleen Cullen.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a status date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Wagner.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Shelton, Br.40.

Defendant Cristian Jahir Hernandez-Becerra in court with attorney Colleen Cullen. BOTH APPEARED BY VIDEO.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Cristian Jahir Hernandez-Becerra in court with attorney Colleen Cullen.  Defendant Cristian Jahir Hernandez-Becerra in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cristian Jahir Hernandez-Becerra appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
